ArticleTitle.sentence: Phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase couples the interleukin-2 receptor to the cell cycle regulator E2F.

AbstractText.sentence: Cell cycle progression initiated by interleukin-2 (IL-2) in T cells is critical for lymphoproliferation and an immune response.

AbstractText.sentence: Phosphatidyl inositol 3-kinase (PI3K) is activated by IL-2.

event.clue: Phosphatidyl inositol 3-kinase (PI3K) is activated by IL-2.

AbstractText.sentence: However, nuclear targets for PI3K are not known.

AbstractText.sentence: Here we identify the cell cycle regulator E2F as an IL-2 target in T lymphocytes and PI3K as the critical signaling pathway.

event.clue: Here we identify the cell cycle regulator E2F as an IL-2 target in T lymphocytes and PI3K as the critical signaling pathway.

AbstractText.sentence: We eliminate both Stat5 and Raf/MEK pathways from E2F regulation.

AbstractText.sentence: Protein kinase B (PKB) is activated by IL-2 via PI3K.
